bibl.title: Military Endorsements for Walter Reed, September 23, 1885

div1.p: Reed has requested four weeks of leave. His commanding officer has asked for an officer to replace him in his absence, but the request for replacement is denied.

div1.head: Military Endorsements for Walter Reed, September 23, 1885
div1.p:
Dept. Comdr. appd provided a
medical officer should be sent
to replace Dr. Reed. Surg.
Gen. remarked that no medical
offr. was now available to
replace Reed.

6386 A.C.P. 85,returned Oct. 31/85,
to the S. G. Div. of the U.S.

[unclear] of Asst. Surg.
Walter Reed, U.S.A. for 4 mos.
leave.

The Dept. Comdr. appd applic.
provided another medical offcr.,
should be sent to Dept. Platte

The Surg. Genl. remarked that
there is no med. offr.
now available for assign-
ment to that Dept.

Abbn retd Oct. 31, 85,
to C.G. Div. U.S., inviting
attention to remarks of
the Surg. Genl.
